artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kiku; Carver: Yokogawa Toyo
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 225; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 296.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three sheets pasted together; three horizontal sections with gods at top, including human figures at right with caricature faces, green and blue demon-like figures at center, creating yellow and red rays; pair of anthropomorphic rabbits pouring out water, and other blue-, green- and red-skinned figures in ULC; central grey area with silhouettes of figures fighting with spears and guns; bottom horizontal section with white demons at left with weapons threatening caricatures at center seated around a table with a yellow patterned tablecloth; demons climbing into a cauldron in LRC
dimension:
14 3/16 × 28 1/8 in. (36.04 × 71.44 cm) (image, vertical ōban triptych)
14 1/2 × 28 5/8 in. (36.83 × 72.71 cm) (sheet)
markings: Censor seal: 辰八改 | Carver\'s seal R: ホリトヨ {hori Toyo}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 梓元の応需芳年戯画 {hanmoto no oju Yoshitoshi giga}
title: Humourous Picture of Heaven, Earth, and Hell
